basics.name: Pavel Vařenka
basics.summary: Platform Engineer with a strong passion for Cybersecurity and DevOps. Constantly striving to improve by staying updated in the professional field and technology overall. Current focus revolves around Dev(Sec)Ops, microservices (Golang/C#/Python), cloud (GCP/AWS/Azure), Infrastructure-as-Code, observability, and automation (SRE). Experienced in secure network architecture, SIEM, penetration testing, cloud security, system administration, and large-scale infrastructure automation. Primary goal is combining cloud security knowledge with DevOps and SRE principles. Advocate for open-source (CNCF), automation, re-usability, and the shift-left approach.

work.summary: DevOps/Platform Engineering projects, both short and long-term ones.

highlights: Managing Azure resources (Container Apps, App Services, SQL server, ServiceBus,...)
Building an internal SDK for developers using Pulumi and C# to enable self-service infra provisioning
Handling SRE, incident management, and troubleshooting production issues
Taking care of CI/CD - GitHub Actions, Octopus Deploy, Azure DevOps
Monitoring using New Relic, Sentry and Grafana
Participating in system design, direction of our product, as well as scaling and bigger initiatives
Trying to automate everything we can :)
Code reviews and support of developers
Promoting DevOps culture and best practices
Enhancing monitoring stack (Loki, Thanos, Consul, Tempo, Prometheus, Grafana) and SRE practices
Light programming in Go and Rego
DevSecOps and security topics (OPA, networking, Kubernetes and container vulnerabilities,...)
Experimenting with distributed systems and novel solutions

work.summary: DevSecOps role primarily focused on Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform/Terragrunt), execution of DRP/BCP at operations level, GitOps workflow (Flux, ArgoCD, Bitbucket Pipelines, monorepo implementation, utilising Helm/Kustomize), and maintenance of Kubernetes clusters on EKS. Also tasked with revamping security measures, migrating new backend services to Kubernetes, introducing GitOps with FluxCD and Kustomize, and creating a new dev environment.

Wide range of responsibilities including compliance, AWS threat hunting, vulnerability scanning, security hardening, ad-hoc mitigation, penetration testing and implementing new tools to secure both the product and the infrastructure. Occasional code review or cooperation with other teams and developers to ensure reliable workflow and application security. Sole implementation of new security tools, advancing company's security posture, and cooperating with DevOps Engineers to reach a consensus regarding new infrastructure components.

Multiple projects covering penetration testing of automotive/IoT/hardware/internal and external infrastructure, threat hunting, internal research regarding uncharted territory of automotive and SCADA vulnerabilities. Most of our projects were done for corporate customers from various backgrounds, most notably logistics, transportation and governmental services.

Vulnerability assessment, systems hardening (Debian/RHEL, Windows,...), maintaining current security infrastructure on-prem and creating new one. Actively participated in network architecture, software engineering from security perspective and SIEM analysis (along with overseeing and mentoring SOC members). Experience with on-premise hardware running virtualization on VMware, firewalls and IPS/IDS solutions, SIEM, maintenance of clusters of VMs, or logically segregating public and private network architecture.
Informing the readers about breaking news in technological field, reporting on advances in various subdomains, preparing research and articles about information security and current events.
